revised_title: Eustachio Zanotti's Observations on the Parabolic Orbit of the 1739 Comet
tldr: Eustachio Zanotti observed the 1739 comet's parabolic orbit and provided details on its motion, perihelion, and position relative to the orbits of Venus and Mercury. The comet's orbit was inclined at an angle of 53°25' to the plane of the ecliptic.
